examples: an ability to interest casual students
showed a casual disregard for cold weather
drove his car with nonchalant abandon
was polite in a teasing nonchalant manner

definitions.text: without or seeming to be without plan or method; offhand
examples: information collected by casual methods and in their spare time

definitions.text: appropriate for ordinary or routine occasions
occurring or appearing or singled out by chance
hasty and without attention to detail; not thorough
examples: a casual (or cursory) inspection failed to reveal the house's structural flaws
a casual correspondence with a former teacher

definitions.text: characterized by a feeling of irresponsibility
examples: a broken back is nothing to be casual about; it is no fooling matter
using their Christian names in a casual way
a difficult feat performed with casual mastery
